cover.headline: How your stress response starts to [reset] after alcohol
cover.subtitle: What changes from week one to month six in your body

slides.title: Week 1: Alarm signals run hot
items: Cortisol (stress hormone) swings, so anxiety spikes faster
Glutamate surges, making sleep light and fragmented
Heart-rate reactivity rises, which can feel like panic

slides.title: Weeks 2-6: Stress system recalibrates
items: Adrenal signaling stays muted, so resilience rebuilds slowly
GABA tone returns, making your baseline feel steadier
Sleep pressure normalizes, which lowers next-day irritability

slides.title: Months 2-6: Response gets more flexible
items: Cortisol awakening response strengthens, so mornings feel less wired
Prefrontal control improves, which dampens threat overreactions
Craving spikes ease, making stress-triggered slips less likely

end.closer: Your nervous system remembers [reset], one day at a time
